block.p: An article April 20 about House passage of legislation that would entitle the residents of the District of Columbia to a full voting representative in Congress incompletely described where members of Congress met after fleeing Philadelphia in 1783, one of the events that led to the creation of the district as a home for Congress. They reconvened first in Princeton, N.J., and later in Annapolis, Md., and Trenton, N.J., before moving to New York in 1785. They did not go directly from Princeton to New York.

An article April 20 about House passage of legislation that would entitle the residents of the District of Columbia to a full voting representative in Congress incompletely described where members of Congress met after fleeing Philadelphia in 1783, one of the events that led to the creation of the district as a home for Congress. They reconvened first in Princeton, N.J., and later in Annapolis, Md., and Trenton, N.J., before moving to New York in 1785. They did not go directly from Princeton to New York.
